item.title: 前 "爱情岛 "明星为推广外汇交易计划认罪
item.description: 一群电视真人秀明星和社交媒体影响者被指控向数百万 Instagram 追随者推销未经授权的外汇交易产品，他们对此不认罪。【原文：A group of reality TV stars and social media influencers pleaded not guilty to accusations that they promoted an unauthorized foreign exchange trading product to millions of Instagram followers.】

item.title: 英国贷款机构警惕抵押贷款违约再次增加
item.description: 由于借贷成本居高不下，房主被迫进行再融资，英国银行正准备应对抵押贷款违约率的再次飙升。【原文：UK banks are bracing for another jump in default rates on mortgages as home owners are forced to refinance at borrowing costs that remain stubbornly high.】

item.title: 智利为 5.52 亿美元的商业地产洪流做好准备
item.description: 随着智利最大的两家房地产投资基金临近清算，智利的投资者正准备迎接罕见的商业楼宇涌入市场。【原文：Investors in Chile are bracing for a rare flood of commercial buildings to hit the market as two of the nation’s largest real estate investment funds near liquidation.】

item.title: 巴克莱认为欧盟 ESG 基金新规带来 300 亿美元抛售风险
item.description: 根据巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）分析师的研究，在欧洲提供环境、社会和公司治理基金的资产管理公司，如果打算在新规定下保留这一标签，可能需要卸载近 300 亿美元的股票和债券。【原文：Asset managers offering ESG funds in Europe may need to offload close to $30 billion in stocks and bonds if they intend to hold onto the label under new rules, according to research by analysts at Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 南非天然气用户计划在 2026 年前确保天然气供应
item.description: 在唯一的天然气供应商表示将于 2026 年停止天然气供应之后，南非的工业天然气用户正计划成立一家公司，以确保天然气供应。【原文：South Africa’s industrial gas users are planning to form a company that will ensure supply after the sole provider of the fuel said it will halt the flow in 2026.】

item.title: 私募基金的创意奇才正在掩盖危险信号
item.description:
由于利率居高不下，收购公司正试图通过各种财务手段来维持运营。投资者希望他们改善公司。【原文：

As interest rates stay high, buyout firms are trying all sorts of financial wheezes to keep things going. Investors want them to improve their companies instead.

】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。交易员们为期待已久的美国通胀数据做好准备，大科技公司在人工智能领域的挥霍令投资者担忧，乔-拜登总统面临更多压力。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Traders brace for much-awaited US inflation data, Big Tech’s AI splurge worries investors and President Joe Biden faces more pressure. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino】

item.title: 毛里求斯中央银行随时准备干预外汇市场
item.description: 毛里求斯中央银行行长表示，在卢比兑美元汇率跌至历史新低后，该机构随时准备干预外汇市场。【原文：Mauritius’s central bank governor said the institution stands ready to intervene in the foreign currency market after the rupee slipped to a new record low against the dollar.】

item.title: 法国必须每年筹集 150 亿欧元以满足欧盟财政需求
item.description: 据知情人士称，法国下届政府将需要每年找到超过 150 亿欧元（162 亿美元）的额外收入或节余，以满足欧盟的要求。【原文：France’s next government will need to find more than €15 billion ($16.2 billion) in extra revenue or savings a year to meet European Union demands, according to people with knowledge of the assessment.】

item.title: 英国是欧洲并购的温床，目标包括 Currys 和 Deliveroo
item.description: 今年下半年，随着交易商在全球最便宜的股票市场之一寻找目标，英国将迎来又一波并购浪潮。【原文：The UK is set to see another wave of mergers and acquisitions in the second-half of the year as dealmakers hunt for targets in one of the world’s cheapest equity markets.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚连续第二个月降息，通胀率保持在目标范围内
item.description: 塞尔维亚央行在数月内第二次降息，在巴尔干国家通胀持续走低的情况下继续放宽政策。【原文：Serbia’s central bank delivered its second interest-rate cut in as many months, following through with easing as inflation in the Balkan nation continues to ebb.】

item.title: 法国政府准备削减开支以安抚市场
item.description: 法国财政部长布鲁诺-勒梅尔（Bruno Le Maire）正在推进削减开支的计划，尽管下届政府的政治前景并不明朗，但他仍试图向市场和欧盟保证法国的财政信誉。【原文：French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire is pressing ahead with planned spending cuts as he seeks to reassure markets and the European Union of the country’s fiscal credibility despite the political uncertainty over the next government.】

item.title: 参议院考虑拜登的联邦存款保险公司总裁人选，银行面临老对手
item.description: 2008 年金融危机后，克里斯蒂-戈德史密斯-罗梅罗作为美国政府银行救助计划的最高监督者，对欺诈或滥用公共资金的银行家采取了强硬的态度。【原文：As the top watchdog for the US government’s bank bailout program after the 2008 financial crisis, Christy Goldsmith Romero took a tough stance against bankers who committed fraud or abused public funds.】

item.title: 法国寻求一位能在总理职位上生存下来的人：看点
item.description: 对于一个更习惯于由总统领导其政府在议会中获得多数票以通过法律的国家来说，法国的临时立法选举造成了一种异常令人困惑的局面。【原文：France’s snap legislative election has caused an unusually perplexing situation for a country more used to having a president whose government commands a majority in parliament to pass laws.】

item.title: 马科斯任命银行家瓦斯莫为菲律宾货币委员会成员
item.description: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯任命银行家 Walter Wassmer 为中央银行利率制定小组成员。【原文：Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. appointed banker Walter Wassmer to the central bank’s rate-setting panel.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司债券因 Ofwat、S&P 加大压力而下挫
item.description: 英国水务监管机构加强了对泰晤士水务公司的审查，S&P 评级公司称可能将其降级为垃圾级，泰晤士水务公司债券跌至历史最低水平。【原文：Thames Water bonds dipped to some of their lowest levels on record after the UK’s water regulator ramped up its scrutiny of the utility and S&P Ratings said it could downgrade it to junk.】

item.title: 乌干达是最新一个将黄金作为货币盾牌的非洲国家
item.description: 乌干达计划在国内购买黄金以建立外汇储备并限制储备投资的风险，成为最新一个转向贵金属以支持其货币的非洲国家。【原文：Uganda plans domestic gold purchases to build foreign exchange reserves and limit risks on reserve investments, becoming the latest African nation to turn to the precious metal to back up its currency.】

item.title: 全球降息预期升温 新兴市场股市创两年新高
item.description: 由于核心经济体和发展中经济体对货币宽松政策的押注增强，风险偏好保持强劲，新兴市场股市再创两年新高，货币也有所上涨。【原文：Emerging-market stocks hit another two-year high and currencies gained as risk appetite stayed strong thanks to stronger bets on monetary easing across core and developing economies.】

item.title: 对国债的巨大赌注需要有利的通胀数据来维持
item.description: 一直期待国债市场反弹的债券投资者现在希望周四的美国通胀数据能为他们背书。【原文：Bond investors who’ve been positioning for a rally in the Treasury market are now looking for an endorsement from Thursday’s US inflation data.】

item.title: 越来越多的环境、社会和治理债务发行人将面临债券处罚
item.description: 现在，越来越多与环境、社会和公司治理挂钩的债券背后的公司可能会面临经济处罚，一旦触发处罚，投资者的回报就会增加。【原文：A growing number of firms behind ESG-linked bonds may now be facing financial penalties that would drive up investor returns once triggered.】

item.title: 高盛策略师称大科技公司的人工智能支出令投资者担忧
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Investors are growing increasingly concerned that US technology megacaps are spending too much on artificial intelligence, according Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 高盛称英镑将创一年新高，应买入英镑
item.description: 在一份报告显示英国经济增长超过预期后，英镑接近一年来的高点，高盛（Goldman Sachs）预计未来几周英镑将继续上涨。【原文：The pound approached a one-year high after a report showed the UK economy grew more than expected, with Goldman Sachs predicting more gains for the currency over the next couple of weeks.】

item.title: BE 研究显示，德国工业遭受了永久性打击
item.description: 彭博经济公司（Bloomberg Economics）的研究表明，德国工业将无法完全摆脱过去几年低迷的影响。【原文：Germany’s industry won’t be able to fully shake off the impact from its downturn of the past years, according to research by Bloomberg Economics.】

item.title: 尽管价格上涨，欧洲可可仍大幅跳水，令人惊讶
item.description: 就在巧克力制造商面临可可豆价格上涨的压力之际，欧洲的可可加工量在第二季度意外增长。【原文：Cocoa processing in Europe unexpectedly rose in the second quarter, just as chocolate makers face pressure from higher bean prices.】

item.title: 约瑟夫-斯蒂格利茨谈如何建立防震供应链
item.description:
鼓励公司进行更长远的思考。【原文：

Encouraging companies to think more long-term.

】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油出口收入降至 4 个月新低，流量减少
item.description: 据国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）称，由于石油出口量略有下降，俄罗斯的石油出口收入降至 2 月份以来的最低点。【原文：Russia’s revenues from oil exports fell to the lowest since February amid slightly lower shipment volumes, according to the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: 核心通胀顽固，秘鲁央行将维持利率不变
item.description: 周四，秘鲁可能将连续第二个月保持基准利率稳定，因为央行青睐的通胀指标仍居高不下。【原文：Peru will likely hold its benchmark interest rate steady for a second straight month on Thursday as a measure of inflation that’s favored by the central bank remains high.】

item.title: 信实工业集团计划提供超过 5 亿美元的海外贷款
item.description: 印度最大的企业信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.）旗下的一个部门正计划借入至少 5 亿美元用于债务再融资，这可能是该企业集团今年的第一笔海外贷款。【原文：A unit of India’s largest company Reliance Industries Ltd. is planning to borrow at least $500 million to refinance debt, in what could be the conglomerate’s first offshore loan this year.】

item.title: 新加坡企业希望马来西亚特区减少繁文缛节
item.description: 据新加坡最高商会的一项民意调查显示，新加坡企业希望与马来西亚建立一个联合经济特区，以减少繁文缛节，帮助解决劳动力和互联互通问题。【原文：Singapore businesses want a planned joint special economic zone with Malaysia to slash red tape and help with labor and connectivity issues, according to a poll by the city’s top chamber of commerce.】

item.title: 日本 40 年期政府债券收益率首次突破 3
item.description: 日本 40 年期国债收益率自 2007 年首次发行以来首次触及 3%。【原文：Japan’s 40-year government bond yield touched 3% for first time since this maturity was first issued in 2007.】
